pullRequest.title: Support regex to include or exclude the names in alarm module
pullRequest.bodyText:
Please answer these questions before submitting pull request

Why submit this pull request?
 Bug fix
 New feature provided
 Improve performance


New feature or improvement

Follow the dev mail list discussion, I provide the regular to include or exclude the names in alarm module.

commit.message: Support regex to include or exclude the names

nodes.bodyText: This default value may break existed versions, right?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -50,6 +50,7 @@ rules:
     metrics-name: service_instance_resp_time
     op: ">"
     threshold: 1000
+    include-names-regex: instance\_\d+

nodes.bodyText: What happens if include names and include names regex exist both? I think we should indicate in the document.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -22,6 +22,8 @@ Alarm rule is constituted by following keys
 [List of all potential metrics name](#list-of-all-potential-metrics-name).
 - **Include names**. The following entity names are included in this rule. Please follow [Entity name define](#entity-name).
 - **Exclude names**. The following entity names are excluded in this rule. Please follow [Entity name define](#entity-name).
+- **Include names regex**. Provide a regex to include the entity names.
+- **Exclude names regex**. Provide a regex to exclude the exclude names.

nodes.bodyText:
This string#matches includes Pattern p = Pattern.compile(regex), due to we have the regex expression before all checked, I think we should compile them first when loading the config or config changed.
Could you run a benchmark to show the performance difference between this and the pre-compiled match?

commit.message: using pre-build mode with regex patten

nodes.bodyText: Just a reminder, as we are using JDK8+, Optional could replace all these !=null. But both of these styles exist today. So, don't require change, anyway.
